quiz.question: Which expensive home juicer required proprietary packets and shut down in 2017?
Which retailer once known for electronics closed stores after being unable to compete with online retailers?
Which instant camera brand's founder, Edwin H. Land, saw the company struggle against digital disruption late in its history?
Which hybrid gaming-phone released in 2003 failed due to awkward design and low sales?
Which smartphone maker released the N-Gage then later abandoned the hybrid gaming-phone concept?
Which company acquired Rdio's assets after Rdio filed for bankruptcy in 2015?
Which modular smartphone project led by Google was canceled before mass production?
Which streaming device attempt by Amazon launched in 2014 and was discontinued after poor sales?
Which consumer device's Explorer Edition launched as a $1,500 prototype targeting developers and early adopters?
Which rapid-delivery startup promised one-hour service and collapsed during the dot-com bust?
Which MP3 subscription service was an early competitor to Spotify but struggled financially?
Which mobile phone's design forced users to hold it sideways to talk, harming its consumer appeal?
Which short-form streaming startup raised large funding then folded within months in 2020?
Which smartphone introduced in 2007 most directly accelerated BlackBerry's market decline?
Which retail chain's collapse highlighted failure to adapt to e-commerce and declining foot traffic in the 2000s?
